[[Seattle, Washington]] | locations = | dissolved = }} '''Ska Studios''' is an independent game development studio founded by James Silva in 2007 after winning a contract to publish ''[[The Dishwasher: Dead Samurai]]'' to [[Xbox Live Arcade]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ms-offers-deals-to-four-xna-devs/1100-6176569/|title=MS offers deals to four XNA devs|website=Gamespot|access-date=February 23, 2020}} Ska Studios has released four Metacritic-aggregated console games since then, more than any similarly sized studio.{{Cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/company/ska-studios|title=Ska Studios|website=Metacritic|access-date=April 26, 2016}} Ska Studios currently consists of James Silva.{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/skastudios/status/1253752923747577858|title=Official Ska Studios Twitter Account|website=Twitter|access-date=April 28, 2020}} The studio is well known in [[indie gaming]] for its art style, which is described as cartoonish, grim, and gory,{{Cite web|url=http://www.indiehangover.com/review-salt-and-sanctuary-by-ska-studios/|title=Review: Salt and Sanctuary by Ska Studios|date=April 19, 2016|website=IndieHangover|language=en-US|access-date=April 26, 2016}} and its games' tight controls.{{Cite web|url=http://www.quadnine.net/reviews/salt-sanctuary-worthwhile-2d-successor-dark-souls/|title='Salt and Sanctuary': A Worthwhile, 2D 'Souls' Successor - Quad Nine|date=April 5, 2016|website=Quad Nine|language=en-US|access-date=April 26, 2016}} Many of the studio's games are strongly inspired by modern action titles, such as ''[[Devil May Cry]]'', ''[[Ninja Gaiden (2004 video game)|Ninja Gaiden Black]]'', and ''[[Dark Souls]]''.{{Cite web|url=http://www.nodontdie.com/james-silva/|title=james silva|date=February 26, 2015|website=don't die|access-date=April 26, 2016}} == Games == [[File:Charlie Murder screenshot 5.png|thumb|261px|right|In ''[[Charlie Murder]]'', players play as members of a garage punk rock band that is fighting a demonic army during the apocalypse.|alt=Four characters stand at the center of a bar, fighting off zombies and ninjas coming towards them from both sides. One of the characters has grabbed a zombie and is on the way down from a pile-driver move.]] {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title !Platform !Developers !Metacritic Score |- | 2009 | ''ZP2K9''{{cite web |url=http://marketplace.xbox.com/en-US/Product/ZP2K9/66acd000-77fe-1000-9115-d802585501ba?DownloadType=Game#LiveZone |title=ZP2K9 - Xbox.com |website=marketplace.xbox.com |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101108205918/http://marketplace.xbox.com/en-US/Product/ZP2K9/66acd000-77fe-1000-9115-d802585501ba/?DownloadType=Game |archive-date=November 8, 2010}} |[[Xbox Live Indie Games|XBLIG]] |James Silva | |- | 2009 | ''[[The Dishwasher: Dead Samurai]]''{{Cite web|url=http://marketplace.xbox.com/en-US/Product/The-Dishwasher/66acd000-77fe-1000-9115-d80258410902|title=The Dishwasher}} |[[Xbox Live Arcade|XBLA]] |James Silva |75 |- | 2009 | ''[[I MAED A GAM3 W1TH Z0MB1ES 1NIT!!!1]]''{{cite web |url=http://marketplace.xbox.com/en-US/Product/I-MAED-A-GAM3-W1TH-Z0MB1ES-1/66acd000-77fe-1000-9115-d802585502a6 |title=I MAED A GAM3 W1TH Z0MB1ES!!!1 - Xbox.com |website=marketplace.xbox.com |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101024021629/http://marketplace.xbox.com/en-US/Product/I-MAED-A-GAM3-W1TH-Z0MB1ES-1/66acd000-77fe-1000-9115-d802585502a6 |archive-date=October 24, 2010}} |XBLIG |James Silva | |- | 2010 | ''ZP2KX''{{Cite web|url=http://marketplace.xbox.com/en-US/Product/ZP2KX-Zombies-Pterodactyls/66acd000-77fe-1000-9115-d80258550732|title=ZP2KX: Zombies & Pterodactyls!|website=marketplace.xbox.com|access-date=April 26, 2016}} |XBLIG |James Silva, Dustin Burg | |- | 2011 | ''[[The Dishwasher: Vampire Smile]]'' |XBLA/[[Microsoft Windows|PC]] |James Silva, Dustin Burg |81 |- | 2012 | ''Z0MB1ES (on {{not a typo|teh}} ph0ne)''{{Cite web|url=https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/apps/z0mb1es-on-teh-ph0ne/9wzdncrfhv6n|title=Z0MB1ES (on {{not a typo|teh}} ph0ne) – Windows Games on Microsoft Store|website=Microsoft Store|access-date=April 26, 2016}} |[[Windows Phone 7|WP7]] |James Silva | |- | 2013 | ''[[Charlie Murder]]'' |XBLA/PC |James Silva, Michelle Juett Silva |78 |- | 2014 | ''TIME VIKING!!!!!ANDSPACERAPTOR''{{Cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/ska-studios-releases-time-viking-andspaceraptor/1100-6416931/|title=Ska Studios releases TIME VIKING!!!!!ANDSPACERAPTOR|website=GameSpot|access-date=April 26, 2016}} |XBLIG |James Silva, Michelle Juett Silva | |- | 2016 | ''[[Salt and Sanctuary]]'' |[[PlayStation 4|PS4]]/PC/[[PlayStation Vita|PS VITA]]/[[Nintendo Switch|Switch]]/[[Xbox One|XB1]] |James Silva, Michelle Juett Silva |85 |- |2022 |''[[Salt and Sacrifice]]''{{Cite magazine|last=Miller|first=Matt|title=Salt And Sacrifice Brings The Soul To Summer Game Fest|url=https://www.gameinformer.com/e3-2021/2021/06/10/salt-and-sacrifice-brings-the-soul-to-summer-game-fest|access-date=June 13, 2021|magazine=Game Informer|language=en}} |[[PlayStation 5|PS5]]/PS4/PC |James Silva, Shane Lynch | 72 |} == History == James Silva began making games as a hobby in 2001, starting with Zombie Smashers X, a River City Ransom style beat-em'-up game, but the title was financially unsuccessful, selling fewer than 100 units. James went on to develop more similarly unsuccessful titles, including Blood Zero, Zombie Smashers X2, and [[Survival Crisis Z]], but didn't achieve viable commercial success until 8 years later, with 2009's ''The Dishwasher: Dead Samurai''.{{Cite web|url=http://www.syfygames.com/news/article/future-icons-meet-ska-studios-indie-gaming-power-couple|title=Future ICONS: Meet Ska Studios' indie gaming power couple|website=www.syfygames.com|access-date=April 26, 2016}} == Development == All of Ska Studios' currently released games are built using the [[Microsoft XNA|XNA]] framework or its open-source cross platform counterpart, [[MonoGame]]. When Xbox One launched with no XNA support, Ska Studios made the switch to PlayStation 4, with ''Salt and Sanctuary'' being the studio's first title to launch on a non-Microsoft console. Regarding the change, James said:
"The engineering side of it was an issue. All of our code is [[.NET Framework|.NET]]/XNA, and, even though XNA support has ended, .NET games can use open source wrappers like MonoGame and FNA to carry the torch. But Xbox One has no .NET support. PS4 does, with titles like ''Towerfall: Ascension'' and ''Transistor'' using MonoGame in one form or another to deploy to PS4."{{Cite web|url=https://www.engadget.com/2014/08/28/ska-studios-shifts-to-sony-after-6-years-on-xbox/|title=Ska Studios shifts to Sony after 6 years on Xbox|website=Engadget|access-date=2016-04-26}}
== References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * {{Official website|http://ska-studios.com/}} [[Category:Video game companies established in 2007]] [[Category:Video game companies of the United States]] [[Category:Video game development companies]] [[Category:Companies based in Seattle]] [[Category:2007 establishments in Washington (state)]] [[Category:Indie game developers]]
contentMetadata.text: Ska Studios is an independent game development studio founded by James Silva in 2007 after winning a contract to publish The Dishwasher: Dead Samurai to Xbox Live Arcade. Ska Studios has released four Metacritic-aggregated console games since then, more than any similarly sized studio. Ska Studios currently consists of James Silva. The studio is well known in indie gaming for its art style, which is described as cartoonish, grim, and gory, and its games' tight controls. Many of the studio's games are strongly inspired by modern action titles, such as Devil May Cry, Ninja Gaiden Black, and Dark Souls. James Silva began making games as a hobby in 2001, starting with Zombie Smashers X, a River City Ransom style beat-em'-up game, but the title was financially unsuccessful, selling fewer than 100 units. James went on to develop more similarly unsuccessful titles, including Blood Zero, Zombie Smashers X2, and Survival Crisis Z, but didn't achieve viable commercial success until 8 years later, with 2009's The Dishwasher: Dead Samurai. All of Ska Studios' currently released games are built using the XNA framework or its open-source cross platform counterpart, MonoGame. When Xbox One launched with no XNA support, Ska Studios made the switch to PlayStation 4, with Salt and Sanctuary being the studio's first title to launch on a non-Microsoft console. Regarding the change, James said: "The engineering side of it was an issue. All of our code is .NET/XNA, and, even though XNA support has ended, .NET games can use open source wrappers like MonoGame and FNA to carry the torch. But Xbox One has no .NET support. PS4 does, with titles like Towerfall: Ascension and Transistor using MonoGame in one form or another to deploy to PS4." Ska Studios About Page "MS offers deals to four XNA devs". Gamespot. Retrieved February 23, 2020. "Ska Studios". Metacritic. Retrieved April 26, 2016. "Official Ska Studios Twitter Account". Twitter. Retrieved April 28, 2020. "Review: Salt and Sanctuary by Ska Studios". IndieHangover. April 19, 2016. Retrieved April 26, 2016. "'Salt and Sanctuary': A Worthwhile, 2D 'Souls' Successor - Quad Nine". Quad Nine. April 5, 2016. Retrieved April 26, 2016. "james silva". don't die. February 26, 2015. Retrieved April 26, 2016. "ZP2K9 - Xbox.com". marketplace.xbox.com. Archived from the original on November 8, 2010. "The Dishwasher". "I MAED A GAM3 W1TH Z0MB1ES!!!1 - Xbox.com". marketplace.xbox.com. Archived from the original on October 24, 2010. "ZP2KX: Zombies & Pterodactyls!". marketplace.xbox.com. Retrieved April 26, 2016. "Z0MB1ES (on teh ph0ne) – Windows Games on Microsoft Store". Microsoft Store. Retrieved April 26, 2016. "Ska Studios releases TIME VIKING!!!!!ANDSPACERAPTOR". GameSpot. Retrieved April 26, 2016. Miller, Matt. "Salt And Sacrifice Brings The Soul To Summer Game Fest". Game Informer. Retrieved June 13, 2021. "Future ICONS: Meet Ska Studios' indie gaming power couple". www.syfygames.com. Retrieved April 26, 2016. "Ska Studios shifts to Sony after 6 years on Xbox". Engadget. Retrieved April 26, 2016. Official website

Ska Studios is an independent game development studio founded by James Silva in 2007 after winning a contract to publish [[The Dishwasher: Dead Samurai]] to [[Xbox Live Arcade]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ms-offers-deals-to-four-xna-devs/1100-6176569/|title=MS offers deals to four XNA devs|website=Gamespot|access-date=February 23, 2020}}</ref> Ska Studios has released four Metacritic-aggregated console games since then, more than any similarly sized studio.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/company/ska-studios|title=Ska Studios|website=Metacritic|access-date=April 26, 2016}}</ref> Ska Studios currently consists of James Silva.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/skastudios/status/1253752923747577858|title=Official Ska Studios Twitter Account|website=Twitter|access-date=April 28, 2020}}</ref>

The studio is well known in [[indie gaming]] for its art style, which is described as cartoonish, grim, and gory,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.indiehangover.com/review-salt-and-sanctuary-by-ska-studios/|title=Review: Salt and Sanctuary by Ska Studios|date=April 19, 2016|website=IndieHangover|language=en-US|access-date=April 26, 2016}}</ref> and its games' tight controls.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.quadnine.net/reviews/salt-sanctuary-worthwhile-2d-successor-dark-souls/|title='Salt and Sanctuary': A Worthwhile, 2D 'Souls' Successor - Quad Nine|date=April 5, 2016|website=Quad Nine|language=en-US|access-date=April 26, 2016}}</ref> Many of the studio's games are strongly inspired by modern action titles, such as [[Devil May Cry]], [[Ninja Gaiden (2004 video game)|Ninja Gaiden Black]], and [[Dark Souls]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.nodontdie.com/james-silva/|title=james silva|date=February 26, 2015|website=don't die|access-date=April 26, 2016}}</ref>

texts.title: History
texts.value: James Silva began making games as a hobby in 2001, starting with Zombie Smashers X, a River City Ransom style beat-em'-up game, but the title was financially unsuccessful, selling fewer than 100 units. James went on to develop more similarly unsuccessful titles, including Blood Zero, Zombie Smashers X2, and [[Survival Crisis Z]], but didn't achieve viable commercial success until 8 years later, with 2009's The Dishwasher: Dead Samurai.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.syfygames.com/news/article/future-icons-meet-ska-studios-indie-gaming-power-couple|title=Future ICONS: Meet Ska Studios' indie gaming power couple|website=www.syfygames.com|access-date=April 26, 2016}}</ref>

texts.title: Development
texts.value:
All of Ska Studios' currently released games are built using the [[Microsoft XNA|XNA]] framework or its open-source cross platform counterpart, [[MonoGame]]. When Xbox One launched with no XNA support, Ska Studios made the switch to PlayStation 4, with Salt and Sanctuary being the studio's first title to launch on a non-Microsoft console. Regarding the change, James said:
"The engineering side of it was an issue. All of our code is [[.NET Framework|.NET]]/XNA, and, even though XNA support has ended, .NET games can use open source wrappers like MonoGame and FNA to carry the torch. But Xbox One has no .NET support. PS4 does, with titles like Towerfall: Ascension and Transistor using MonoGame in one form or another to deploy to PS4."{{Cite web|url=https://www.engadget.com/2014/08/28/ska-studios-shifts-to-sony-after-6-years-on-xbox/|title=Ska Studios shifts to Sony after 6 years on Xbox|website=Engadget|access-date=2016-04-26}}
